name: Cape Verdean Music
description: Music developed in the archipelago of Cape Verde.

children.name: Batuque
children.description: Tradition from Cape Verde, unusual among the islands' music due to its lack of polyphonic singing and its usage of polyrhythms.

children.name: Coladeira
children.description: Originated as a more uptempo and lively form of Morna before bringing in outside influences.

children.name: Funaná
children.description: Upbeat Cape Verdean style which developed on the island of Santiago, based around the diatonic accordion and rhythm provided by the ferrinho.

children.name: Morna
children.description: Slow tempo, monotonality, and the use of the violão, the Cape Verdean classical guitar, as the main instrumental accompaniment.
